It can take days to reach many destinations traveling on land, so unless you've got time to spare and cash to hire a 4x4 and a driver who knows Guyana's back roads, it's best to book a flight with one of the local carriers operating out of Ogle Airport (ogleairportguyana.com), or join a tour group like the ones organized by Wildness Explorers (wilderness-explorers.com).
Just don't expect more than a rustic guesthouse with a couple spare rooms, or a public pagoda with a hammock.
Most points of interest have airstrips for small planes, and accommodations nearby.
